meanings.definition: To fianchetto (verb): to develop a bishop by moving it to the b2 or g2 square.
meanings.sent1: In chess, fianchettoing the bishop can protect the king's side.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys fianchettoing her bishops early in the game.
meanings.sent3: The bishop was fianchettoing happily, unaware of the impending checkmate.
meanings.sent4: His strategic fianchettoing of the bishop allowed for a swift attack.
meanings.sent5: The art of fianchettoing the bishop requires careful planning.

meanings.definition: Fianchettoed (adjective): having a bishop developed on the b2 or g2 square.
meanings.sent1: The fianchettoed bishop controlled the long diagonal effectively.
meanings.sent2: Players often prefer a fianchettoed bishop for its flexibility.
meanings.sent3: The fianchettoed bishop seemed to be winking at the opponent.
meanings.sent4: Her fianchettoed bishop stood like a guardian on the board.
meanings.sent5: The fianchettoed position gave the bishop a commanding view of the battlefield.
